instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165-A no backlight
threads.message: Water damaged around USB on board. Cleaned. Feeback trace is good. I get 20V out, nothing on screen. I've tried another display, same thing. What am I missing?

threads.title: 820-00165-A no backlight
threads.message:
Did you try PRAM reset?.
Check BKL_PWM signal when press backlight control keys.
You may need to change LP8550...

threads.title: 820-00165-A no backlight
threads.message:
I tried PRAM and nothing. 
What are backlight control keys? PRAM combo? 
I?ll report back with BKL_PWM voltage tomorrow.

threads.title: 820-00165-A no backlight
threads.message: Try new driver 20 volts is super close. 21.8-26 volts is usually normal on these

threads.title: 820-00165-A no backlight
threads.message:
BKL_PWM is 1.5V. 
Tried new backlight IC, nothing.

threads.title: 820-00165-A no backlight
threads.message:
PWM stable 1.5V pressing backlight control keys?
Srill stuck on 20V, after changing the chip?
All return resistors OK?
Post diode mode (red probe at ground) on return lines, measured on LCD connector side; w/ and w/o LCD connected.

threads.title: 820-00165-A no backlight
threads.message:
Apparently no connection here. Let's see if this voltage divider starts to work again.

SOLVED: connection made, divider works.
